Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: oil painting of a raging cyclops

On a large, square canvas the scene of a rocky cavern has been depicted in solemn tones with oil paint. Long strokes of green, grey, black and white have been skilfully manipulated to dull and blur the background so that the figures partially surrounding the raging cyclops in the centre are brought to attention by contrast of detail. The cyclops itself has mottled skin, similar to a toad in color and texture, with bulky muscles, a ragged hempen cloth about its waist and a dazzling heart crystal for an eye. While the presence of the crystal would imply the blindness of the creature, a beam of light radiates from within and out over a horse and fox in the foreground; this is created by bold brush strokes of red paint. In the right hand of the cyclops is a tree-sized maul riddled with bloody, iron spikes. This he uses to smash against the nearby walls of the cavern, creating the fall of large and thin stalactites and the billow of white hot steam from the stalagmites below. Several shapes and sizes can be seen amongst the geysers and massive, falling rocks at the edge of the painting, particularly that of a cat with a length of rope in his hands. Brilliant splashes of blood red oil paint mark the shapeless figures within the watery mist, being the brightest color used in the entirety of the portrait. The floor is strewn with sharp iron nails and sporadic pools of cave water, the surfaces spraying here and rippling there with the disturbance of both people and debris. Drawing towards the centre-front of the oil painting are the aforementioned horse and fox; the horse appears to be wearing the Avoirdupois colors, a massive steel longsword held in an aggressive stance, while the fox is dressed in Rinaldi attire, a steel scimitar in his own hands. Both are poised to attack the cyclops as it looks down upon them with his scarlet heart-shaped eye, their blades catching the light with an eerie metallic sheen and their faces - the horse's scarred - set with hardened determination. In the bottom, right-hand corner is the name 'Una' written in blood red paint, the U dotted with eyes in imitation of a morbid smiley face.

On a large, square canvas the scene of a rocky cavern has been depicted in solemn tones with oil paint. A mottled green cyclops stands in the very center wielding a spiked and blooded maul, his foes the Avoirdupois percheron and Rinaldi fox in the foreground under his scarlet, heart-shaped crystal eye.
